content.description:
Climb V5 to the first bolt, then do a 2 move V10 boulder problem (bad, left hand, sloper crimp to a flat undercling). From the third bolt to the anchors is around V7 or harder.

This took me 2 days and around 80 tries just to do the 2 move crux, but the climb could be harder or easier depending on your height.
content.location: Park at the large pullout on the south side of the road, about 500 feet after the first tunnel heading up Clear Creek Canyon. Walk across the metal bridge crossing the river, and then walk back up stream to this overhanging boulder that lies just a couple of feet from the edge of the river (there is no potential waterfall). This climb is 4 bolts long to 2 bolt anchors.
